meanings.definition: To behave in a cowardly manner.
meanings.sent1: He cravened when faced with a difficult decision.
meanings.sent2: The soldier cravened and abandoned his post during the battle.
meanings.sent3: The cat cravened at the sight of a tiny mouse.
meanings.sent4: Her heart cravened at the thought of speaking in front of a large audience.
meanings.sent5: The child cravened at the idea of going into the dark basement alone.

meanings.sent1: The cravened knight refused to face the dragon.
meanings.sent2: She felt cravened when asked to confront the bully.
meanings.sent3: The cravened squirrel ran away from a tiny chipmunk.
meanings.sent4: His cravened behavior in the face of danger disappointed his friends.
meanings.sent5: The cravened rabbit trembled at the sound of a distant thunderstorm.
